intro: [WRONG START] Casia domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican chia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Casasia domingensis is often cultivated for both ornamental purposes and as a source of edible seeds.
